TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void WebPartCancelEventHandler(object sender, WebPartCancelEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed WebPartCancelEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub WebPartCancelEventHandler(sender As Object, e As WebPartCancelEventArgs)
public delegate void WebPartCancelEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, WebPartCancelEventArgs ^ e);
type WebPartCancelEventHandler = delegate of obj * WebPartCancelEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event, event, or event of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The method specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartCancelEventHandler> delegate is called when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.SelectedWebPartChanging> event, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartClosing> event, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.WebPartDeleting> event is raised.
Page developers can provide custom handlers for Web Parts events by adding an `OnSelectedWebPartChanging` attribute, `OnWebPartClosing` attribute, or `OnWebPartDeleting` attribute to the `<asp:webpartmanager>` element in a page, and assigning a custom method name to the attribute. A custom handler can also be assigned programmatically. For more information about how to subscribe to an event, see [How to: Raise and Consume Events](~/docs/standard/events/how-to-raise-and-consume-events.md).
